description.narrative: National Health Insurance, the vehicle to provide individuals and families with necessary health benefits without sacrificing other areas of life or worrying about forcing them back into poverty.

activity-description.narrative: Support for the development of a National Health Insurance programme

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Fully staffed and operationalised NHI secretariat and project implementation plan 2. Availability of a fully costed Range of Services and Benefits Package 3. Availability of endorsed proposal on the Organizational, Governance and Staffing arrangements for the NHI Programme (NHI) 4. Availability of endorsed proposal for NHI Programme (NHI ) Revenue Generation Options 5. Availability of a national macroeconomic and health insurance capacity analysis report 6. Availability of draft, stakeholder-endorsed NHI Legislation and Regulations 7. Availability of Capacity building activity reports 8. Availability of endorsed Standards of Care and Contracts with Health Services Providers 9. Availability of design and specification report for an effective NHI Health Information Technology Platform 10. Availability of stakeholder engagement plan and implemented public education and advocacy 11. Availability of a comprehensive NHI website

comment.narrative: 1. No NHI secretariat staff or project implementation plan 2. No agreement on the range of services and benefits to be covered under an NHI 3. No formal agreement on the institutional administrative framework for the NHI 4. No formal agreement on NHI Programme (NHI ) Revenue Generation Options 5. No data-informed assessment of the capacity of the economy to support a national health insurance system 6. No legislative or regulatory framework for national health insurance 7. No existing capacity for NHI administrative body to implement NHI programme 8. No arrangements with Health Services Providers for Standards of Care under a proposed NHI 9. No existing IT system to manage and administer the proposed NHI 10. No structured and systematised stakeholder engagement plan on the proposed NHI framework 11. No dedicated web presence to communicate NHI-related information with the public

1. NHI secretariat fully staffed and annual work plan completed 3. Completion and endorsement of proposed Revenue Generation Options 5. Formal endorsement of proposed National macroeconomic and health insurance capacity analysis by the government 6. Completion and endorsement of proposed NHI Legislation and Regulations 7. Completion of capacity building activities to support the operationalisation of an NHI administrative body 8. Completion and endorsement of Standards of Care and Contracts with Health Services Providers 9. Completion and endorsement of Design and specification report for an effective NHI Health Information Technology Platform 10. Completion of implementation of Stakeholder engagement plan and advocacy activities 11. Completion of and full operational NHI website

1. All staff were hired, including communications position, however the project head resigned and the administrative assistance was made acting project head. Annual work plan for 2019 was completed and board approved. 3. Proposed Revenue Generation Options was completed was approved for payment by government and is with Cabinet for approval 4. The National Macroeconomic and health insurance capacity analysis was formerly endorsed by the government 5. NHI Legislation and Regulations were completed and accepted by the government, Cabinet approval is pending 7. Capacity building activities to support the operationalisation of an NHI administrative body have been completed and reports available 8. The Standards of Care and Contracts with Health Services Providers have been completed was approved for payment by government and is with Cabinet for approval 9. The completion and endorsement of Design and specification report for an effective NHI Health Information Technology Platform is outstanding 10. The Stakeholder Engagement Plan was completed and associated advocacy activities have been implemented and are ongoing 11. The NHI website is completed but is still to be launched/operationalised
